description: People in Shropshire village will have to wait until the end of July for a storm-damaged road to reopen.
title: Cardington: Long wait for road repairs causing concern for villagers
title_page: Cardington: Long wait for road repairs causing concern for villagers - BBC News
maintext:
People living in a village will have to wait until the end of July for a road collapse to be repaired.
A storm in December caused the damage to the Grove Farm Culvert in Cardington, Shropshire, and that road is now closed.
Cardington North Bridge also suffered damage and has been temporarily repaired by Shropshire Council, with a more permanent repair promised by mid-September.
Villagers have complained about the ongoing disruption, and one resident, Mike Rust, said: "It's the very fabric of the village that changes."
He said people were being sent on diversions down country lanes, adding 20 minutes or more to their journey times.
Mr Rust also said he worried about how some of the roads would cope when they become busy with farm vehicles later in the year.
He claimed one of the lanes was already "disintegrating in front of our eyes".
